[SYNTAX]: Some lengthy, complex sentences may slightly impede smooth reading flow.
[TRANSITION]: Minor abruptness between paragraphs (e.g., shift from personal anecdote to historical context).

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unconnected shifts between disparate topics (e.g., Bahá’í community, pre-Industrial village description, François Boucher tangent).
[LOGIC]: Lack of clear thematic or narrative progression across the section.

[LEXICON]: Occasionally formal or wordy phrasing (e.g., "desirous of making a good personal impression").

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt, unrelated paragraph about Reynolds’ career disrupts thematic continuity.
